news_items.content: Here is the rewritten news in a clear and concise format:
The Indian government has launched an expert-approved diet guide to help people keep their brains sharp and healthy. The guide can be downloaded from various websites.
Amazon's CEO has stated that generative AI will revolutionize every customer experience. The company is investing in research and development of this technology.
EU Sees Opportunity in AI Boom
The European Union believes the AI boom has the potential to catch up with the US. They are planning to invest heavily in AI research and development.
The International Energy Agency (IEA) has said that AI will be crucial for global energy production and growth. The agency is working with governments and companies to develop new technologies.
A Harvard professor has used a new AI technology to replicate himself as a tutor experiment. This innovation could lead to significant advancements in education.
Meta, the company behind Instagram and Facebook, has invested heavily in their chatbot platform, ChatGPT. They are working on developing this technology further.
The Indian stock market is expected to open higher today as investors await updates from the US-China trade war. The Sensex has surged over 1,100 points and the Nifty is above 22,750.
Two Indian companies, Sun Pharma and Tata Consultancy Services (TCS), are down on the stock market. Their performance has been affected by weak global cues.
Despite escalating US-China trade tensions, the global stock market is expected to open higher today. Investors remain optimistic about the growth potential of emerging technologies like AI.
